Detailed Description

Define the interface for querying properties of a device.

Function Documentation

◆ QDMI_query_device_property_dev()

int QDMI_query_device_property_dev ( QDMI_Device_Property prop,
int size,
void * value,
int * size_ret )

Query a device property.

This function queries a property of a device. The property can be one of the predefined properties in QDMI_Device_Property. The property can be of different types, such as defined for the individual property. The function returns the value of the property in the memory pointed to by value.

Parameters
[in]propis an enumeration constant that identifies the platform information being queried. It can be one of the values specified for QDMI_Device_Property.
[in]sizespecifies the size in bytes of memory pointed to by value. This size in bytes must be greater or equal to the size of the return type specified for the QDMI_Device_Property prop.
[out]valueis a pointer to a memory location where appropriate values as specified for the QDMI_Device_Property prop, will be returned. If value is NULL, it is ignored.
[out]size_retreturns the actual size in bytes of data being queried by prop. If size_ret is NULL, it is ignored.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the function is executed successfully. Otherwise, it returns one of the following error codes:
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if prop is not one of the defined values, if the size in bytes specified by size is less than the size of the data being queried as specified for the QDMI_Device_Property prop and value is not a NULL value, or if both value and size_ret are NULL.
QDMI_ERROR_NOTSUPPORTED if the property is not supported by the device.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if an unexpected error occurred.

◆ QDMI_query_get_operations_dev()

int QDMI_query_get_operations_dev ( int num_entries,
QDMI_Operation * operations,
int * num_operations )

Get the operations available on the device.

Parameters
[in]num_entriesthe number of entries that can be added to devices. If devices is not NULL, num_entries must be greater than zero.
[out]operationsreturns a list of operations available on the device. The QDMI_Operation values returned in operations can be used to identify a specific QDMI_Operation. If operations is NULL, this argument is ignored. The number of QDMI_Operation values returned is the minimum of the value specified by num_entries and the number of operations found.
[out]num_operationsreturns the number of operations available. If num_operations is NULL, this argument is ignored.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the function is executed successfully. Otherwise, it returns one of the following error codes:
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if num_entries is less than or equal to zero and operations is not NULL or if both operations and num_operations are NULL.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if an unexpected error occurred.

◆ QDMI_query_get_sites_dev()

int QDMI_query_get_sites_dev ( int num_entries,
QDMI_Site * sites,
int * num_sites )

Get the sites associated with device.

Parameters
[in]num_entriesthe number of entries that can be added to devices. If devices is not NULL, num_entries must be greater than zero.
[out]sitesreturns a list of sites available on the device. The QDMI_Site values returned in sites can be used to identify a specific QDMI_Site. If sites is NULL, this argument is ignored. The number of QDMI_Site values returned is the minimum of the value specified by num_entries and the number of sites found.
[out]num_sitesreturns the number of sites available. If num_sites is NULL, this argument is ignored.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the function is executed successfully. Otherwise, it returns one of the following error codes:
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if num_entries is less than or equal to zero and sites is not NULL or if both sites and num_sites are NULL.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if an unexpected error occurred.

◆ QDMI_query_operation_property_dev()

int QDMI_query_operation_property_dev ( QDMI_Operation operation,
int num_sites,
const QDMI_Site * sites,
QDMI_Operation_Property prop,
int size,
void * value,
int * size_ret )

Query an operation property.

This function queries a property of an operation. The property can be one of the predefined properties in QDMI_Operation_Property. The property can be of different types, such as defined for the individual property. The function returns the value of the property in the memory pointed to by value.

The device may return QDMI_ERROR_NOTSUPPORTED also if the queried property cannot be provided for the given sites. E.g., some properties may only be available as an average value for all sites. Those may, nevertheless, be queried through this function by providing no sites at all, i.e., passing NULL to sites.
Parameters
[in]operationis the name of the operation for which the property is queried.
[in]num_sitesis the number of sites for which the property is queried.
[in]sitesis a list of indices of the sites for which the property is queried or can be NULL. If sites is NULL, the property is queried for all sites, e.g., as an average value over all sites.
[in]propis an enumeration constant that identifies the platform information being queried. It can be one of the values specified for QDMI_Site_Property.
[in]sizespecifies the size in bytes of memory pointed to by value. This size in bytes must be greater or equal to the size of the return type specified for the QDMI_Site_Property prop.
[out]valueis a pointer to a memory location where appropriate values as specified for the QDMI_Site_Property prop, will be returned. If value is NULL, it is ignored.
[out]size_retreturns the actual size in bytes of data being queried by prop. If size_ret is NULL, it is ignored.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the function is executed successfully. Otherwise, it returns one of the following error codes:
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if operation is an invalid operation, if num_sites is less than or equal to zero and sites is not NULL, if prop is not one of the defined values, if the size in bytes specified by size is less than the size of the data being queried as specified for the QDMI_Site_Property prop and value is not a NULL value, or if both value and size_ret are NULL.
QDMI_ERROR_NOTSUPPORTED if the property is not supported by the device or for the given list of sites.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if an unexpected error occurred.

◆ QDMI_query_site_property_dev()

int QDMI_query_site_property_dev ( QDMI_Site site,
QDMI_Site_Property prop,
int size,
void * value,
int * size_ret )

Query a site property.

This function queries a property of a site. The property can be one of the predefined properties in QDMI_Site_Property. The property can be of different types, such as defined for the individual property. The function returns the value of the property in the memory pointed to by value.

Parameters
[in]siteis the index of the site for which the property is queried.
[in]propis an enumeration constant that identifies the platform information being queried. It can be one of the values specified for QDMI_Site_Property.
[in]sizespecifies the size in bytes of memory pointed to by value. This size in bytes must be greater or equal to the size of the return type specified for the QDMI_Site_Property prop.
[out]valueis a pointer to a memory location where appropriate values as specified for the QDMI_Site_Property prop, will be returned. If value is NULL, it is ignored.
[out]size_retreturns the actual size in bytes of data being queried by prop. If size_ret is NULL, it is ignored.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the function is executed successfully. Otherwise, it returns one of the following error codes:
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if site is an invalid site, if prop is not one of the defined values, if the size in bytes specified by size is less than the size of the data being queried as specified for the QDMI_Site_Property prop and value is not a NULL value, or if both value and size_ret are NULL.
QDMI_ERROR_OUTOFRANGE if the site index is out of range, i.e., less than zero or greater than the number of sites minus one.
QDMI_ERROR_NOTSUPPORTED if the property is not supported by the device.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if an unexpected error occurred.
